MAC data functions
[Route Under Mac (RUM)]

Collaboration diagram for MAC data functions:

Detailed Description

This module includes code for sending and receiving data using the MAC.

Data is sent to another node on the network using macDataRequest(), and incoming packets are routed to macDataIndication(), which calls appDataIndication().

If 6LoWPAN is being used, do not call macDataRequest() directly, but use the 6LoWPAN implementation for AVR functions (AVR only).

Function Documentation

void macDataIndication ( void   ) 

This function is called when the MAC receives a packet that is addressed to this node.

The packet is dispatched according to its contents.

u8  len,
u8 *  data 
)

The macsixlowpanDataRequest function is used to send a frame over the air to another node.

Any node type can call this function.

Parameters:
addr Short address of the destination node.
len The length of the packet in bytes.
data Pointer to the data to be sent.

void macSendStoredFrame ( u16  addr  ) 

Send a frame that has been stored for a child node.

This is meant to be called immediately upon receiving a packet from a sleeping child node.

void macsixlowpanDataRequest ( u16  addr,
u8  len,
u8 *  data 
)

The macsixlowpanDataRequest function is used to send a frame over the air to another node.

Note that the IPV6LOWPAN flag must be set to use any 6LoWPAN functionality.

Parameters:
addr Short address of the destination node.
len The length of the packet in bytes.
data Pointer to the data to be sent.

u16  child 
)

The macWakeRequest function is called by the coordinator to send a wakeup packet to a router.

addr Short address of the parent router of the node to wake up.
